abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory, and
            sustainability is likely. The overall Bank performance was
            satisfactory, although the implementing agency's
            capacity was not adequately appraised, thus the overall
            borrower performance is considered unsatisfactory, based on
            various associated problems, such as delayed release of
            funds, lack of commitment to planning objectives, and a
            continual political interference. The key lessons suggest,
            primarily, that strengthening of basic institutional
            capacities need to be prepared, and implemented at the
            earliest stages of the project cycle, to acquire the
            procurement capabilities required to support a decentralized
            government system to fully manage work. In turn, financial
            autonomy, and timely budget releases become paramount for
            accountability results to prod a stronger decentralized role
            in contracting works. Certain force account public works
            will remain necessary services, for traffic levels do not
            justify the commercial viability for emergency
            interventions, but there is a continual commercialization
            for machinery, and equipment year round, whose privatization
            should be accelerated. It is suggested stakeholders should
            be involved as of preparation, and ensure both beneficiary
            and community participation, to impact effectively, not only
            on the decentralization process, but on the project as a whole.
